page.title: 18Wivelsfield - Religion
page.content: {Wivelsfield Parish Church of St.Peter {and St.John the Baptist}is situated in Church Lane. The church was given to Wivelsfield in 1095 by William de Warrenne. Its walls are of sandstone,rubble and ashlar under a tiled roof.Parts of the church date back to the 11th century with later additions in the 13th,14th,and 15th as well as in modern times. There is an ancient Yew in the churchyard which is twisted and split. The church is used regularly for Services and the Vicar lives nearby at the Vicarage. { {Ote Hall Congregational Chapel}was given by the Countess of Huntingdon, who lived at nearby Great Ote Hall, in 1778.A modern extension was added in 1950. The chapel is still in regular use for Services and Sunday school.
